skillTree.localised_description: The Dukes of Bretonnia will command their hosts of Knights from the backs of mighty barded steeds.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: The purest of all pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: Taming a mighty hippogryph presents a challenge that many Bretonnian lords cannot turn down.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: A Knightly formation, in the Lady's name, to smash through battle lines; to defeat evil in the field.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A champion of the common man, this duke is beloved by those he protects. Wherever he fights, the peasants doubles their efforts and will fight to the death rather than dishonour their lord.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: The Chevaliers de Lyonesse were formed to defend Lyonesse against its enemies by Repanse de Lyonesse and they have remained in service ever since.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Knights Errants and Knights of the Realm units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Knights Errants and Knights of the Realm units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Knights Errants and Knights of the Realm units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Lyonesse is the birthplace of Trebuchets, construction that has fended them off against Norscan raiders countless times and has earned the respect of Adalhard.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Superior War Machine" for Trebuchet units
	(Lord's army)

Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Duke keeps himself aloof from the politics of his dukedom as far as possible. If a conflict spreads to the point that he can’t ignore it, he typically takes his forces in, crushes all parties, seizes their lands, and declares a resolution.

Lyonesse is dotted with the hills that locals call Mottes. As many people have noted, they could have been designed as a place to put a castle, but they appear to be entirely natural. These days, every motte has a castle or the ruins of a castle on top of it.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 when under siege
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description:
"I anoint myself with the blood of Ulric that I shall not fear to bleed.
	I pledge myself to Ulric's work that I shall not fear to suffer.
	I give myself to Ulric, that I shall not fear to die."

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: "The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and offer their devotion."

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: Even dull and stupid peasants can aim a bow, but with a little training they can learn to shoot with some success.

skillTree.localised_description: The bloodline of the noblest of all steeds has been preserved; it serves us still.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who serve the Lady purely are rewarded with a portion of her strength when battle is joined.

skillTree.localised_description: Although nothing can replace the thrill of the charge and the righteous clash of steel, seriously heavy artillery generally helps.

skillTree.localised_description: When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...

skillTree.localised_description: Thou shalt be everywhere and always the champion of the Right and the Good against Injustice and Evil.

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Dukes are the highest rank within Bretonnian society, second only to the Royarch himself.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Paladins
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Dukedom of Lyonesse is a founding Dukedom that lies upon the north-western shores of Bretonnia. One of the larger Dukedoms following its annexation of Mousillon several centuries earlier, the lands of Lyonesse are infamously known for their rivalry with not other Bretonnian realms, but amongst their own nobility, even in comparison to the other realms of Bretonnia.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -30% for Knights Errants and Knights of the Realm units
	(all armies)

Leadership: +8 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: A cloak of pure white fur harvested by Duke Adalhard himself, this cloak can withstand the harshest blows.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Duke Adalhard appears to be a simple man. He excels on the battlefield and, whilst off it, enjoys feasting, gambling, and the other entertainments of warriors.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Knights Errants and Knights of the Realm units

Casualty replenishment rate: +20% for Knights Errants and Knights of the Realm units
	(Lord's army)
